issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
According to AIM documentation path names must begin with '/'. While the new
(fancy ;)) web UI enforces this restriction at the user creation time, it is
possible to modify the path to anything (I successfully set it to '../../..')
in the user Properties form.

  
I could not find if there are other AIM restrictions on path names, but I
would expect more restrictions than just "path must start with /".  It would
be great if we could find out the exact restrictions because allowing a wide
set of characters in the path is not generally safe and might lead to a
security hole later on.
fields.summary: web UI: it's possible to create a path name that does not start with '/'

comments.body:
Originally posted on 2011-06-03 19:51:56

Fri Jun 03 12:51:56 2011: Request 2429 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Ticket created by vika.felmetsger
       Queue: Engineering Bugs
     Subject: web UI: it's possible to create a path name that does not start
 with '/'
       Owner: Nobody
  Requestors: Vika.Felmetsger@eucalyptus.com
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: http://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=2429 >


 According to AIM documentation path names must begin with '/'. While the new
(fancy ;)) web UI enforces this restriction at the user creation time, it is
possible to modify the path to anything (I successfully set it to '../../..')
in the user Properties form.

I could not find if there are other AIM restrictions on path names, but I would
expect more restrictions than just "path must start with /". It would be great
if we could find out the exact restrictions because allowing a wide set of
characters in the path is not generally safe and might lead to a security hole
later on.

Originally posted on 2011-06-03 19:57:41 by wenye
Good catch. Will fix.

Originally posted on 2011-06-03 19:57:43 by admin
The attached WSDL for IAM includes information such as regex's, etc. for paths
and names.  It's quite useful.

Originally posted on 2011-06-03 19:57:44 by admin
http://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=2429 This is a comment.
It is not sent to the Requestor(s): The attached WSDL for IAM includes
information such as regex's, etc. for paths and names. It's quite useful.
